title: 'Mythbusters' to end after 14 seasons
text:
'Mythbusters' to end after 14 seasons Show's co-hosts talk exclusively to Entertainment Weekly UPDATED 10:40 AM HST Oct 21, 2015 Photos Jamie Crawford/CNN The upcoming 14th season of Discovery's "Mythbusters" will be the show's last, according to a report Wednesday from Entertainment Weekly . Why did One Direction break the... The pioneering series, known for its over-the-top experiments proving and, well, busting myths, will wrap up following 248 episodes. The upside, as co-hosts Adam Savage and Jamie Hyneman told EW, is they knew the end was coming ahead of time and were able to craft the final season of "Mythbusters" as an explosive final goodbye to fans. "It was my greatest fear that 'Mythbusters' would just stop and we wouldn't be able to do proper final episodes," Savage told EW in the exclusive interview. The two, who famously have never really been friends offscreen and requested to be interviewed separately for by EW, will tour starting next month with one final "Mythbusters Live" show and both say they plan to return to television eventually, although in different veins. Savage said he'd like to host more television, but Hyneman, a special effects expert by trade, said he would prefer to work behind the scenes more. "We felt like we've had really strong material for the whole run," Hyneman said. "It's been 14 years and it's just time. We want to go out on a strong point." 
The final season of "Mythbusters" starts Jan. 9 on Discovery.
